title: 25.3 Johnson's Algorithm
content:
Section 25.3

Johnson's Algorithm

Summary

All-pairs shortest paths in sparse graphs using reweighting.

Key Points

  • Better than Floyd-Warshall for sparse graphs
  • Add new vertex s, run Bellman-Ford from s
  • Reweight edges: ŵ(u,v) = w(u,v) + h(u) - h(v) ≥ 0
  • Run Dijkstra from each vertex with new weights
  • Time: O(VE + V² log V) with Fibonacci heaps

Pseudocode

JOHNSON(G, w):
    add vertex s, edges (s,v) with weight 0
    if BELLMAN-FORD(G', w, s) == FALSE:
        return "negative cycle"
    for each v: h(v) = δ(s, v)
    for each edge (u,v):
        ŵ(u,v) = w(u,v) + h(u) - h(v)
    for each vertex u:
        run DIJKSTRA(G, ŵ, u)
        for each v: d(u,v) = δ̂(u,v) + h(v) - h(u)
    return D

Why It Matters

Fastest for sparse graphs with negative edges.
